intro: Coulteria lewisii, commonly known as Lewis's coulteria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a hairy texture. Coulteria lewisii is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
